articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Andorra vs England in the UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
articles.title: Andorra vs England LIVE: World Cup 2026 Qualifier score, stats & updates

articles.description: Follow live text and BBC 5 live radio commentary from the French Open at Roland-Garros, the second Grand Slam tournament of the year.
articles.title: French Open Final 2025 LIVE: Sabalenka vs Gauff - score, results & radio from Roland Garros

articles.description: Coco Gauff wins the first French Open singles title of her career by fighting back to beat world number one Aryna Sabalenka in a rollercoaster final.
articles.title: French Open 2025: Coco Gauff beats Aryna Sabalenka to win first Roland Garros title

articles.description: Captain Nat Sciver-Brunt finishes unbeaten on 57 as England thrash West Indies by nine wickets at Taunton to secure a series clean sweep.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Nat Sciver-Brunt guides hosts to series clean sweep over poor Windies

articles.description: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo says he will not play at the Club World Cup after rejecting offers from participating teams.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo rejects offers to play at Club World Cup

articles.description: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min says sacked manager Ange Postecoglou is a "legend" who has "changed the trajectory of this club".
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min says Australian is club 'legend'

articles.description: World number two Rory McIlroy says he is "concerned" about his form heading into the US Open after struggling with his driver at the Canadian Open.
articles.title: Rory McIlroy 'concerned' for US Open after driver issues at Canadian Open

articles.description: Olympic champion Simone Biles calls former US swimmer and activist Riley Gaines "sick" over online comments about a transgender woman softball player.
articles.title: Simone Biles calls former US swimmer Riley Gaines 'sick' in trans rights row

articles.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says he sees "no reason" to appoint a permanent captain of the side at this stage after discussions with his squad.
articles.title: Denmark v Northern Ireland - build-up to 18:00 BST kick-off

articles.description: Leinster overpower Glasgow Warriors to oust the reigning champions and ease into the United Rugby Championship final.
articles.title: Leinster 37-19 Glasgow: Six-try hosts beat holders to reach URC final
